title: Old videos revived in the context of recent India-China border standoff
subtitle: While it is true that there are tensions at the border between India and China, the posted videos are old, and are not related to the recent incidents along the LAC
author: factly.in
vclaim:
Several videos are being widely shared on social media with a claim that they are related to the recent India-China border stand-off. Let’s fact-check the claim made in the posts.

Fact: While it is true that there was a standoff between Indian & Chinese troops near the border, the videos posted are old. They are not related to the recent incidents along the LAC. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.

When the same video went viral in 2019 as then recent video, FACTLY has debunked the video and found the video to be related to a conflict that took place on 15 August 2017 between Indian and Chinese soldiers near Pangong lake in Ladakh.

When the screenshots of the video were run through the Yandex Reverse Image Search, the same video was found in the search results. A user has uploaded the same video on 13 January 2020 with the title – ‘Chinese army arguing with Indo Tibetan Border Police (I.T.B.P.) in Border of Arunachal Pradesh’. So, the video is not related to the recent incidents in May 2020.

The same video is being circulated on the internet at least from 2017. The ‘Deccan Herald’ has posted the same video on YouTube in July 2017 with the title – ‘Watch: Jawans stop Chinese soldiers from entering Indian territory Part 1’.

To sum it up, several old videos revived in the context of recent India-China border standoff.
